sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The MIT krb5 package contains compile-et, ftp, ftpd, gss-client, gss-server, k5srvutil, kadmin, kadmin.local, kadmind, kadmind4, kdb5_util kdestroy, kinit, klist, klogind, kpasswd, kprop, kpropd, krb5-send-pr, krb5-config, krb524d, krb524init, krb5kdc, kshd, ksu, ktutil, kvno, login.krb5, rcp, rlogin, rsh, rshd, rxtelnet, rxterm, sclient, sim_client, sim_server, sserver, telnet, telnetd, uuclient, uuserver, v5passwd, v5passwdd, libcom_err, libdes425, libgssapi, libgssrpc, lib5crypto, libkadm5clnt, libkadm5srv, libkdb5, libkrb4, libkrb5.

sect3.title: compile_et
sect3.para: compile_et converts the table listing error-code names into a C source file.

sect3.title: k5srvutil
sect3.para: k5srvutil is a host keytable manipulation utility.

sect3.title: kadmin
sect3.para: kadmin is an utility used to make modifications to the Kerberos database.

sect3.title: kadmind
sect3.para: kadmind is a server for administrative access to Kerberos database.

sect3.title: kinit
sect3.para: kinit is used to authenticate to the Kerberos server as principal and acquire a ticket granting ticket that can later be used to obtain tickets for other services.

sect3.title: kdestroy
sect3.para: kdestroy removes the current set of tickets.

sect3.title: kdb5_util
sect3.para: kdb5_util is the KDC database utility.

sect3.title: klist
sect3.para: klist reads and displays the current tickets in the credential cache.

sect3.title: klogind
sect3.para: klogind is the server that responds to rlogin requests.

sect3.title: kpasswd
sect3.para: kpasswd is a program for changing Kerberos 5 passwords.

sect3.title: kprop
sect3.para: kprop takes a principal database in a specified format and converts it into a stream of Heimdal database records.

sect3.title: kpropd
sect3.para: kpropd receives a database sent by hprop and writes it as a local database.

sect3.title: krb5-config
sect3.para: krb5-config gives information on how to link programs against libraries.

sect3.title: ksu
sect3.para: ksu is the super user program using Kerberos protocol. Requires a properly configured /etc/shells and ~/.k5login containing principals authorized to become super users.

sect3.title: ktutil
sect3.para: ktutil is a program for managing Kerberos keytabs.

sect3.title: kvno
sect3.para: kvno prints keyversion numbers of Kerberos principals.
